text: Your Snapscore indicates
how active you are on Snapchat.

It can be found by
clicking on your profile
under your profile icon.
Your Snapscore counts how many Snaps
you've sent and received,
how many Stories you viewed and posted,
how many Discover videos you've watched,
and how many friends you have.
If you click on the number,

you can see how many Snaps
you've sent and received.

There are a few ways to
increase your overall Snapscore.

First, try sending and
receiving more Snaps.

Snapstreaks, when you Snap
the same friend consecutively

for at least three days,
will boost your Snapscore.
The longer you consecutively Snap them,
the higher your Snapscore.

Posting and viewing Stories
will increase your Snapscore.
This is another form of interacting
and communicating with friends.

You can add more friends
to increase the amount
of people that you're interacting with.

If you have multiple streaks
with multiple friends,
your score will increase.
If you'd like to get competitive,
you can also see your friends' Snapscore.
To do this, scroll down to "My Friends."

Tap on a friend's icon
to display their profile.
Here, you can see their Snapscore
in the same location as your own.
